column2: MASSACHUSETTS DMV WRITTEN TEST
column6: MA

column2: Question Text
column6: Answer2 Text
column8: Answer3 Text

column2: 1. To drive defensively, you must:
column4: assume that a driver who approaches a STOP sign on a side road is actually going to stop.
column6: anticipate errors by other drivers.
column8: use only one hand on the wheel.
column10: not check behind you through your mirrors.

column2: 2. What does this sign indicate?
column4: Drivers will soon be on a roadway with two-way traffic.
column6: Rounabout ahead.
column8: The highway ahead is divided into two one-way roadways.
column10: Winding road ahead. Drive with caution.

column2: 3. When exiting a highway, you should slow down:
column4: once you have moved into the exit lane.
column6: before moving into the exit lane.
column8: when you first see the exit sign.
column10: once you see the toll booth.

column2: 4. Regulatory signs are:
column6: Guides
column8: Law

column2: 5. When driving in heavy rain, drivers should use:
column6: emergency flashers.
column8: parking lights.

column2: 6. What is a likely effect when you take another drug while you drink alcohol?
column4: The effects of alcohol are reduced by the drug.
column6: If the drug is over-the-counter, there are no effects.
column8: The effects of the alcohol and the drug are enhanced.
column10: There are no effects, unless the drug is prescription only.

column2: 7. How many different  classes of mopeds are there?
8. A large vehicle is backing up to unload goods. You should:
column6: be patient and wait until the large vehicle has completed its backup maneuver.
column8: enter one of the blind spots and wait.

column2: 9. A 4-way stop sign means:
column4: Traffic from all four directions must stop.
column6: There are four stop signs at the intersection.
column8: The first vehicle to reach the intersection should move forward first.

column2: 10. If traffic on the other side of an intersection is backed up and you cannot get completely through, you must:
column4: turn right instead of going straight through the intersection.
column6: enter the intersection and proceed with caution.
column8: enter the intersection and try to avoid blocking it.
column10: wait until traffic ahead is clear.

column2: 11. A vehicle is stopped at a crosswalk to permit a pedestrian to cross the roadway. The driver of the vehicle approaching from the rear should:
column6: overtake and pass the stopped vehicle.
column8: not overtake and pass the stopped vehicle.

column2: 12. If you stop along the road at night:
column6: turn off all your lights.
column8: turn on your emergency flashers and leave your low beams on.
column10: turn off your emergency lights and leave your high beams on.

column2: 13. On what three conditions does your blood alcohol content (BAC) depend?
column4: Your height. How much alcohol you drink. The type of beverage you drink.
column6: Your weight. How much alcohol you drink. How much time passes between drinks.
column8: Your weight. The type of beverage you drink. How fit you are.
column10: How fit you are. How much alcohol you drink. Your height.

column2: 14. This sign means:
column4: Warning: a bikeway crosses the roadway ahead.
column6: Bicycles should yield to vehicles ahead.
column8: The lane ahead is reserved for bicycles.

column2: 15. On average, how long does it take your body to remove the alcohol contained in 5 ounces of wine?
column6: 30 minutes.
column8: one hour.

column2: 16. Directions given by traffic officers ___________ signs, signals or pavement markings.
column6: never take precedence over
column8: must obey

column2: 17. Drivers may pass another vehicle if the line dividing two lanes is a ________ line.
column6: solid white
column8: broken white

column2: 18. A speed limit is the __________ speed at which a vehicle may legally travel on the road under ideal conditions.
column6: maximum
column8: suggested

column2: 19. Drivers should allow a larger space cushion when stopping:
column6: on an up-hill.
column8: at a yield sign.

column2: 20. What should drivers do when they see this road sign?
column6: come to a complete stop and wait for a train to cross.
column8: increase their speed to cross the intersection before a train arrives.
column10: slow down, look for a train, and be prepared to stop.

column2: 21. This sign means:
column6: You must yield the right-of-way ahead
column8: You must stop ahead

column2: 22. If an aggressive driver is behind you:
column4: try to get out of the aggressive driver’s way.
column6: sound your horn and move to the left lane.
column8: increase you speed and flash your brake lights.
column10: slow down and confront the aggressive driver.

column2: 23. When a hazard is seen ahead, reaction distance:
column4: is the sum of perception distance and braking distance.
column6: equals total stopping distance minus perception distance.
column8: is how far a vehicle will continue to travel, in ideal conditions, before the driver hits the brakes.

column2: 24. When driving in icy or snowy conditions, to avoid crashes drivers should:
column4: add extra weight to the vehicle to improve traction.
column6: reduce speed and increase following distance.
column8: get off the highway as quickly as possible.
column10: engage 4 wheel drive on the vehicle.

column2: 25. Following another vehicle too closely is known as:
column6: closetailing.
column8: tailgating.
